Intermediate Example

This example shows

  • how to change a configuration value

Prepare the files with configuration definitions (e.g. “basic_example.yaml”).

 1# mgconfig configuration definitions 
 2# for advanced application configuration
 3
 4- section: application
 5  prefix: app
 6  configs:
 7
 8  - name: name
 9    type: str
10    readonly: True
11    default: appname
12    description: name of the application (read only)
13
14  - name: basedir
15    type: path
16    readonly: True
17    default: /$(app_name)_data
18    env: DATA_DIRECTORY
19    description: base directory for application execution
20
21  - name: configdir
22    type: path
23    readonly: True
24    default: $(app_basedir)/configs
25    env: CONFIG_DIRECTORY
26    description: configuration directory
27
28  - name: configfile
29    type: path
30    readonly: True
31    default: $(app_configdir)/$(app_name)_config.yaml
32    env: CONFIGFILE
33    description: full pathname of configuration file
34
35- section: examples
36  prefix: tst
37  configs:
38
39  - name: name
40    type: str
41    default: original string
42    description: example for a read/write configuration item which can be read from and written to configuration file

Import the configuration module and load the prepared configuration definition file:

 1from mgconfig import Configuration, prepare_temp_data_directory
 2
 3# this function create a new and empty data directory for testing purposes
 4prepare_temp_data_directory(__file__)
 5
 6
 7TESTITEMNAME = 'tst_name'
 8
 9# ---------------------------------------------------------------------
10# configuration instance creation
11# ---------------------------------------------------------------------
12config = Configuration("config_defs/cd_example_2_intermediate.yaml")
13
14print(f"Test configuration value for app_name: {config.app_name}")
15print(f"Test configuration value for app_basedir: {config.app_basedir}")
16
17
18# ---------------------------------------------------------------------
19# display and change TESTITEM (of config type str)
20# ---------------------------------------------------------------------
21
22print(
23    f'Original configuration value for {TESTITEMNAME}: {config.get_value(TESTITEMNAME)}')
24
25# as the config data file (YAML) will not be found in the empty directory, it will be created.
26# you can find this file in the basedir after running this example
27config.save_new_value(TESTITEMNAME, 'new string', apply_immediately=True)

Advanced Usage

  • Overriding configuration from environment variables

  • Merging multiple configuration definition files

Example with environment override:

import os
from mgconfig import Configuration

os.environ["DATABASE_HOST"] = "localhost"
config = Configuration("settings.yaml")

print(config.get("database_host"))
